item.title: Qué significa ‘beatific’
item.description: Esta palabra ha aparecido en 17 artículos en NYTimes.com en el último año. ¿Puedes usarla en una frase?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Word of the Day: beatific
item.description: This word has appeared in 17 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Late Night Tries to Decipher Another Rambling Trump Speech
item.description: Among other things, President Trump claimed to be a big hit with Black voters. But Desi Lydic says her potato salad is getting better numbers.
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: Late Night with Seth Meyers (TV Program)
The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (TV Program)

item.title: What Trump’s National Security Strategy Gets Right About Europe
item.description: It’s an actual place, not an arbitrarily bounded zone.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Caldwell

media:content.media:credit: Jan Staiger for The New York Times

item.title: Mexico Approves 50% Tariffs on Many Chinese Imports
item.description: The tariffs will apply to goods from China and other nations. Washington has been pressuring Mexico to move away from dealing with China.
item.dc:creator: Jack Nicas and James Wagner

media:content.media:description: A display of cars by the Chinese automaker BYD in the Mexican city of Ciudad Juarez. China is the second largest exporter to Mexico after the United States.

item.title: Al rey emérito de España le cuesta seguir adelante
item.description: Con la publicación de sus memorias, Juan Carlos I espera una reconsideración y una resurrección más de una década después de su tragicómica caída.
item.dc:creator: Jason Horowitz
item.category: Juan Carlos I, King of Spain

media:content.media:description: Juan Carlos I de España, en febrero. Se le ha dejado prácticamente al margen de las recientes celebraciones del 50 aniversario de la transición de España a la democracia, en la que desempeñó un papel decisivo.

item.title: Former King Juan Carlos I of Spain, Seeking Relevance, Publishes Book
item.description: King Juan Carlos I of Spain abdicated and left for exile years ago. Now, his attempted comeback is giving his family a royal headache.
item.dc:creator: Jason Horowitz
item.category: Juan Carlos I, King of Spain

media:content.media:description: Juan Carlos I of Spain, in February. He has been mostly left out of recent celebrations of the 50th anniversary of Spain’s transition to democracy, in which he was instrumental.

item.title: Los retos para la seguridad de Europa van más allá de la falta de apoyo de Trump
item.description: Mientras los europeos se encuentran varados entre potencias hostiles, Rusia y Estados Unidos, se avecinan decisiones clave sobre el futuro de Ucrania.
item.dc:creator: Steven Erlanger
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Laetitia Vancon para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Un convoy de vehículos militares estadounidenses pasa por Frankenberg, Alemania, camino a Polonia, en 2024 para unos ejercicios de la OTAN.

item.title: No Corrections: Dec. 11, 2025
item.description: No corrections appeared in print on Thursday, Dec. 11, 2025.

item.title: Quote of the Day: Global Impact Seen as Australia’s Ban on Social Media for Youth Takes Effect
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, December 11, 2025.

item.title: Escape from Darfur
item.description: In late October, just days before the city of El Fasher fell to the Rapid Support Forces

media:content.media:credit: Ivor Prickett for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: There are few men, many are feared dead.

item.title: María Corina Machado Appears in Norway After Missing Nobel Ceremony
item.description: María Corina Machado, who spent over a year in hiding in Venezuela, greeted supporters in Oslo, hours after her daughter accepted the Nobel Peace Prize in her name.
item.dc:creator: Genevieve Glatsky

media:content.media:credit: Jonas Been Henriksen/NTB Scanpix, via Associated Press
media:content.media:description: María Corina Machado greeting supporters in Oslo from a hotel balcony early on Thursday morning.

item.title: A Rule Disqualified Equestrians Who Bloodied Their Horses. Top Riders Fought It.
item.description: In January, the blood rule, which ousted riders if their horses bled during competition, will change to a system of warnings and suspensions.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Maslin Nir

media:content.media:description: Rodrigo Pessoa and his mount Major Tom, of Team Brazil, competing in the Jumping Individual Final at the 2024 Olympic Games. Pessoa said that those against the changes to the blood rule “don’t understand the sport.”

item.title: Some Horse Breeds Are Near Extinction. These People Are Trying to Save Them.
item.description: The American Cream Draft is almost gone, as is the ancient Caspian. But it’s too late for the Narragansett Pacer, once owned by George Washington.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Maslin Nir

item.title: In the Sport of Driving, Four Horses Pull a Cart Around an Arena. Fast.
item.description: The spectacle is reminiscent of the movie “Ben Hur,” with high-speed action and roaring crowds. Teamwork is crucial.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Wulkan

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Dec. 11, 2025
item.description: Kevin Curry wants us to really think about his puzzle.
item.dc:creator: Deb Amlen

media:content.media:description: This dog is encouraging its owner to try Kevin Curry’s puzzle.

item.title: ICE Says It Has No Videos to Release of Chicago Deportation Operations
item.description: The response to an information request contradicted the administration’s public testimony and raised concerns that it may be trying to evade oversight.
item.dc:creator: Minho Kim
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A federal agent in tactical gear confronted residents in the Little Village neighborhood of Chicago in October.

item.title: EE. UU. incauta un petrolero frente a la costa de Venezuela, según Trump
item.description: La medida se produce cuando Estados Unidos aumenta sus fuerzas en el Caribe como parte de una campaña de presión contra Nicolás Maduro, líder de Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Pager, Eric Schmitt and Nicholas Nehamas

media:content.media:description: El presidente Trump anunció la incautación en la Casa Blanca el miércoles, sin dar detalles sobre la operación.

item.title: Judge in Oregon Blocks Arrest of Protesters For Noise
item.description: Federal agents outside an ICE detention facility in Eugene, Ore., had sought to enforce a new rule that prohibits “creating a loud or unusual noise” outside federal property.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron

media:content.media:credit: Jordan Gale for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: In October, federal agents arrested a person outside of a federal ICE detention center in Portland.

item.title: One of the Last Times Square Dive Bars Faces Eviction
item.description: New York is a city of hustlers, of odds makers and shot takers. For 54 years, Jimmy’s Corner has been their bar.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Maag

media:content.media:credit: Natalie Keyssar for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Memorabilia lines the walls of Jimmy’s Corner, a bar that’s been in Times Square for 54 years.

item.title: Gavin Newsom: ‘We Failed on the Border’
item.description: Gov. Gavin Newsom has pushed California to offer health insurance to undocumented immigrants. He also thinks the Democratic Party has failed on border policy in recent years. On a recent episode of “The Ezra Klein Show,” he explains why.
item.dc:creator: ‘The Ezra Klein Show’

item.title: Gavin Newsom on California’s ‘Original Sin’
item.description: Newsom has emerged as a front-runner for the Democratic Party’s 2028 ticket. But will he be able to reconcile his track record as the governor of one of the least affordable states in the country?
item.dc:creator: ‘The Ezra Klein Show’

item.title: Gavin Newsom Is Embracing Contradiction
item.description: Gov. Gavin Newsom has resisted the Trump administration with his push to redistrict California, while also inviting major right-wing figures like Steve Bannon and Charlie Kirk on his podcast. In a recent conversation on “The Ezra Klein Show,” he explains why he’s willing to take these risks.
item.dc:creator: ‘The Ezra Klein Show’

item.title: Ukrainian Women Tell Their Stories of Sexual Violence by Russian Soldiers
item.description: Hundreds of Ukrainian women and girls have reported sexual violence by Russian troops during the nearly four years of full-scale war in Ukraine

media:content.media:credit: Lynsey Addario for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Nina says she tested positive for hepatitis C after being beaten and raped by a Russian soldier in her own home.

item.title: Defense Bill Will Make D.C. Skies Less Safe, N.T.S.B. Chair Says
item.description: The chair of the National Transportation Safety Board warned that a provision in the new defense bill would worsen the risk of midair collisions near the Washington-area airport where a deadly crash in January killed 67 people.
item.dc:creator: Karoun Demirjian
item.category: Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation
United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: Jennifer Homendy, the N.T.S.B. chair, said she would be concerned about the safety of flying in Washington’s airspace if the provision became law.

item.title: A Mysterious Fire, a Helpful Neighbor and a Murder Charge
item.description: Virginia Cranwell, 82, died in a fire in her New Jersey home this summer. Her neighbor, who claimed he had tried to save her, now faces murder and arson charges.
item.dc:creator: Andy Newman

item.title: Oil Tanker U.S. Seized Off Venezuela Has Faked Its Location Before, Data Shows
item.description: The ship has frequently carried oil from countries under U.S. sanctions, and its tracking data shows multiple recent trips to Iran and Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Christiaan Triebert and Riley Mellen

item.title: Always on My Mind: Trump’s Enduring Focus on Joe Biden
item.description: After nearly 11 months in office, the president’s tendency to talk about his predecessor is more pronounced than ever.
item.dc:creator: Shawn McCreesh

media:content.media:description: President-elect Donald J. Trump and President Biden at Mr. Trump’s inauguration in January. Mr. Trump’s allies dispute the idea that he is obsessed with his predecessor.

item.title: House Gives Bipartisan Approval to $900 Billion Defense Bill
item.description: The legislation codifies President Trump’s agenda but includes a few measures challenging his policies and insisting on more consultation with Congress.
item.dc:creator: Megan Mineiro
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:description: Speaker Mike Johnson at the Capitol on Wednesday.

item.title: Man Admits to Strangling Pregnant Woman in 1996, Settling Cold Case
item.description: Gregory Fleetwood, 69, pleaded guilty to manslaughter on Wednesday in the killing of 36-year-old Jasmine Porter. He is expected to be sentenced to 12 years in prison.
item.dc:creator: Chelsia Rose Marcius

media:content.media:credit: Jefferson Siegel for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Gregory Fleetwood, right, pleaded guilty in State Supreme Court in the Bronx on Wednesday, three years after his arrest in the 1996 killing.

item.title: Britain Releases New Data on ‘Grooming Gangs’ and Child Sexual Abuse
item.description: The police in Britain warned that the threat from online predators has been rising while political attention has been focused elsewhere.
item.dc:creator: Lizzie Dearden

media:content.media:description: Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood has called for a “moment of reckoning” in the inquiry into child sexual abuse in Britain.

item.title: Lawsuit Challenges Park Service Passes Featuring Trump
item.description: An environmental group is suing, saying federal law requires an image of public lands, not the president.
item.dc:creator: Maxine Joselow

item.title: Nursing Home Owners Pocketed Millions as Patients Suffered, Report Says
item.description: As the owners intentionally understaffed two New Jersey facilities and diverted Medicaid money for their own use, residents in the homes “suffered unnecessarily,” the state comptroller said.
item.dc:creator: Camille Baker

media:content.media:description: The owners of the Hammonton Center for Rehabilitation and Healthcare and Deptford Center for Rehabilitation and Healthcare were accused of purposely understaffing the homes.

item.title: M23 Rebels Seize Uvira in Eastern Congo
item.description: The fighting in Congo continues despite Washington’s claims to have brokered an end to the conflict.
item.dc:creator: Saikou Jammeh and Ruth Maclean
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

media:content.media:description: With the capture of Uvira, the militia M23 now controls both the North and South Kivu regions in eastern Congo.

item.title: La cocina italiana, el maquillaje kohl y el ‘yodel’ son reconocidos por la Unesco
item.description: La Unesco añadió decenas de candidatos a su lista anual del “patrimonio cultural inmaterial” del mundo, que celebra las costumbres y la cocina internacionales.
item.dc:creator: Lynsey Chutel
item.category: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization

media:content.media:description: Comiendo pasta en Roma el miércoles. El comité de la Unesco dijo que la tradición culinaria italiana “pone énfasis en la relación íntima con la comida, el respeto por los ingredientes y los momentos compartidos alrededor de la mesa”.

item.title: What Democrats Can Learn From Biden’s Immigration Policy Mistakes
item.description: As 2028 takes shape, Democrats will face a version of the same dilemma.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Flavelle
item.category: US Strikes on Alleged Drug Traffickers (2025- )

media:content.media:description: President Joe Biden at the U.S.-Mexico border in El Paso in 2023.

item.title: George Altman, Slugger in Negro Leagues, M.L.B. and Japan, Dies at 92
item.description: The rare player to compete in all three, he had an impressive career, becoming a three-time All-Star in the major leagues and later a fan favorite in Japan.
item.dc:creator: Michael S. Rosenwald

item.title: The U.S. Seized an Oil Tanker Near Venezuela
item.description: Also, the Fed’s latest rate cut was contentious. Here’s the latest at the end of Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Cullen

item.title: U.S. Seizes Oil Tanker Off Venezuela’s Coast, Trump Says
item.description: President Trump announced that the United States had seized an oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela on Wednesday.

media:content.media:description: President Trump announced the seizure at the White House on Wednesday, without giving details on the operation.

item.title: Donald McIntyre, 91, Dies; Starred in New Vision of Wagner’s Operas
item.description: As Wotan in Patrice Chéreau’s neo-Marxist staging of the “Ring” cycle, he was part of a celebrated, polarizing moment in opera history.
item.dc:creator: Adam Nossiter

media:content.media:description: Donald McIntyre as Wotan and Gwyneth Jones as Brünnhilde in Wagner’s “Die Walküre” at the Royal Opera in London in 1978. Two years before, Mr. McIntyre had starred as Wotan (alongside Ms. Jones) in a groundbreaking new production of Wagner’s “Ring” operas at the Bayreuth Festival in Germany.

item.title: What Is a Trump Gold Card? Applications Open for Million-Dollar Visas.
item.description: President Trump has framed the program as a way for the government to raise billions of dollars and prioritize the admission of successful entrepreneurs and investors.
item.dc:creator: Madeleine Ngo

item.title: How to Fight Rising Utility Bills? Take Over the Company, Activists Say.
item.description: A grass-roots coalition is trying to push New York State to use eminent domain to buy out Central Hudson Gas & Electric and replace it with a public authority.
item.dc:creator: Grace Ashford

item.title: Washington Faces Heavy Rain and Flooding From Atmospheric River
item.description: Tens of thousands of people there and in nearby British Columbia were poised to evacuate as heavy rain caused flooding and sent rivers rising to dangerous levels.
item.dc:creator: Amy Graff

item.title: After Shutdown, Democrats Claim Credit for Funding They Opposed
item.description: Several Democrats who fought to steer federal money to their states and districts have boasted about their success even after voting against the bill that provided the funds.
item.dc:creator: Catie Edmondson

item.title: DealBook Summit: Reckoning with the ‘New Normal’
item.description: At this year’s DealBook Summit, there was an understanding that in the Trump era, business runs through the White house like never before.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Ross Sorkin

item.title: 13 Charged in Gang-Related Attack That Killed 16-Year-Old in Harlem
item.description: The defendants, members of the “OY” gang, were charged with attempted murder in the death of Tresaun Clements, who was not affiliated with a gang, prosecutors said.
item.dc:creator: Hurubie Meko

media:content.media:credit: Ahmed Gaber for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The defendants were charged in State Supreme Court in Manhattan as part of efforts by the police and prosecutors to take down local gangs.

item.title: From the DealBook Summit: Industry Leaders Share Their Insights
item.description: Representing a variety of public and private sectors, guests from technology and finance to education and the artsparticipated in a lunchtime discussion designed to spark conversation around critical questions of the day.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Karsten Moran for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Experts in business and politics gathered last week at the DealBook Summit in New York.

item.title: The President of the Yaddo Artist Retreat Steps Down
item.description: After a quarter century, the Yaddo president Elaina Richardson will step down, having made her mark on the storied arts residency.
item.dc:creator: Elisabeth Egan

media:content.media:credit: Erik Tanner for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: In her 25 years leading Yaddo, Elaina Richardson has increased the artist residency’s endowment more than fourfold.

item.title: Stephen Downing, Police Officer Who Wrote for TV, Dies at 87
item.description: While serving in the L.A.P.D., he began delivering scripts for series like “Dragnet” and “Adam-12.” After retiring, he was a showrunner for “MacGyver.”
item.dc:creator: Richard Sandomir
